title: Ticket #1887: We should check the executable bit
description: As a noob, one of the most frustrating things about Condor is submitting a job, only to have to check the log to see that there is some problem with the executable. The case I am thinking about mostly is where one writes a shell script with a text editor and forgets to turn the executable bit on. It should be easy for condor_submit to check the executable bit of an "executable" and see that it is off, and then warn the user that their job is not going to run.
remarks:
2011-Jan-30 07:38:38 by matt:
It would be even better if a check happened in the starter so the HoldReason could be augmented to state why exec failed.

2011-Jan-31 15:26:34 by gthain:
I think this patch breaks java universe, as the .class file is listed as the executable, but doesn't need the executable bit set. We should also check what happens with VM universe, as there isn't a bona-fide executable there.

2011-Mar-02 15:31:47 by nwp:
It looks like #1361 is addressing the same issue
